    • Method Detail

      • setThinnedImage

        public void setThinnedImage(int[][] thImg)
        set the thinned phase congruence image, a.k.a. the edge image. the image should be in row-major notation.
        Parameters:
        thImg -

      • getThinned

        public int[][] getThinned()
        get the thinned phase congruence image, a.k.a. the edge image. Note that the array is accessed as a[row][column], row major notation.

      • getThinnedLowNoise

        public int[][] getThinnedLowNoise()
        get the thinned phase congruence image that was built if the user specified 'extract noise'. Note that the array is accessed as a[row][column], row major notation.
        Returns:

      • getNoiseyPixels

        public java.util.Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> getNoiseyPixels()
        Returns:
        noisey pixels are found by subtracting the resulting pc image made with the user given k from a default k which allows more noise into the image. The resulting "noisey" pixels may be useful for designing texture filters to remove such pixels from better keypoints. Note that the coordinates are in the reference frame of the GreyscaleImage instance, col major notation.

      • getSubsetNoise

        public java.util.List<java.util.Set<algorithms.util.PairInt>> getSubsetNoise()
        Returns:
        the subset of noiseyPixels that are the smallest clusters of points and furthest away from edges in the lower noise image. Note that the coordinates are in the reference frame of the GreyscaleImage instance, col major notation.

      • setNoiseyPixels

        public void setNoiseyPixels(java.util.Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> pixels)
        set pixels derived from the 'extract noise' feature of the phase congruency detector. Note that the points should be using coordinates that are in the reference frame of the GreyscaleImage instance, col major notation.
        Parameters:
        pixels -

      • getPhaseCongruency

        public double[][] getPhaseCongruency()
        return the gradient image produced by phase congruency as a double array of values in range 0 to 1.0. Note that the array is accessed as a[row][column], row major notation.
        Returns:
        the phaseCongruency

      • getOrientation

        public double[][] getOrientation()
        return the orientation image. Note that the array is accessed as a[row][column], row major notation.
        Returns:
        the orientation

      • getPhaseAngle

        public double[][] getPhaseAngle()
        return the phase angle image. 
         Local weighted mean phase angle at every point in the image.
 A value of
                pi/2 corresponds to a bright line,
                0 corresponds to a step and
                -pi/2 is a dark line.
        Note that the array is accessed as a[row][column], row major notation
        Returns:
        the phaseAngle

      • getThreshold

        public double getThreshold()
        Returns:
        the threshold
